This game is fast, fun and very hard to master!  Ive played the game a bit 15 years ago and not touched it since but then I decided to start playing again 4 months ago or so. Since then I have played intensively - like 20-30 hours a week. Only resently have I begun to be able to deal a bit of competition to my Silver I-III opponents. 
You should also be aware that even how good you get you will still get smashed big looong time to a cheaters - cause there is a lot of them!
Even taking the above into account I still highly recommend the game if you are looking for a fast shooter with a high grade of tactical team play.

This game has been out for many years, and it truly does stand the test of time. Even though it's mechanics are quite different from modern day FPS games people know like Call of Duty or Battlefield, they are still very captivating and have a very large skill curve that makes the game entertaining as hell. It requires a lot of practice and getting used to the game in general in order to feel like you've gotten better, and that's what is really fun about the game. I highly suggest playing competitive games with friends or downloading some of the workshop maps to try out. Most of the features are also free, so it doesn't hurt to give cs:go a try (8/10).

Very realistic, story of my life. BEST. GAME. EVER
